metadata.title: CVE-2016-6313 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
The mixing functions in the random number generator in Libgcrypt before1.5.6, 1.6.x before 1.6.6, and 1.7.x before 1.7.3 and GnuPG before 1.4.21make it easier for attackers to obtain the values of 160 bits by leveragingknowledge of the previous 4640 bits.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
gnupg-curl - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
gpgv - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.2').
gnupg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.20-1ubuntu3.1').
